Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video was recorded in Indian-administered Kashmir after Article 370 was scrapped, when in reality it was recorded in Karnal, Haryana, two years prior.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support its assertion that the video shows police detaining female protesters in Indian-administered Kashmir after Article 370 was scrapped.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is recent and related to the events in Indian-administered Kashmir, which is a problematic assumption as the video is actually from a different location and time.
Exist alternative explanation: The video has an alternative explanation, as it actually depicts a protest by female teachers in Karnal, Haryana, unrelated to the events in Indian-administered Kashmir.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the video by falsely attributing it to the recent events in Indian-administered Kashmir, thus misleading viewers.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting false information and misrepresenting the origin and context of the video.
